query: What is the latest in US political news for today?

articles.title: Here’s the latest.
6 Takeaways From Gavin Newsom’s Appearance on ‘The Daily’
articles.description: The governor bragged about working with ICE in California but said that President Trump was “trying to gin things up to create problems” at protests.

articles.title: Republicans to Press Hochul, Walz and Pritzker on Immigration in Hearing
articles.description: Amid unrest in California, Republicans plan to press the governors of other blue states on their immigration policies, including on limiting cooperation with federal enforcement efforts.

articles.title: Charging Your EV May Be Getting Easier, Even if It’s Not a Tesla
articles.description: It is becoming easier to find fast chargers for electric vehicles, and they are more likely to work — and not just for Teslas.

articles.title: Defense Lawyers for Kilmar Abrego Garcia Ask Judge to Release Him Pretrial
articles.description: The request came as lawyers in Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia’s separate civil case were poised to ask a different judge to hold the Trump administration in contempt for sidestepping one of her orders.

articles.title: Duffy Backs Safety Audit After Deadly Crash Near National Airport
articles.description: An investigation will examine what could have prevented an Army Black Hawk helicopter from ramming into an American Airlines flight on Jan. 29, killing all on board both aircraft.

articles.title: David Hogg to Exit DNC After Backlash to His Primary Plan
articles.description: Mr. Hogg said he would not run again for vice chair after the party voted for a new election. Democrats have been furious at his plan to challenge the party’s sitting lawmakers in primary races.

articles.title: New China Trade ‘Deal’ Takes U.S. Back to Where It Started
articles.description: If a handshake agreement holds, it will merely undo some of the damage from the trade war that President Trump started.

articles.title: In Trump’s Washington, ‘You Don’t Leave Home Without Your Lawyer’
articles.description: There’s a lot of work for lawyers in the nation’s capital these days: Over 400 lawsuits have been filed against President Trump’s administration since the start of his second term.

articles.title: Trump Bends Military’s Role, Suggesting More Troops in More Cities
articles.description: President Trump has expanded domestic use of the armed forces, testing the limits on involving troops at protests and the border.

articles.title: Chris Mason: Reeves and Starmer can't escape sluggish economy
articles.description: The PM and chancellor badged their Spending Review as start of a new chapter but the economic backdrop is inescapable.

articles.title: Reeves refuses to rule out tax rises after economy shrinks
articles.description: The chancellor highlights "uncertainty" in the world as economists warn of tax rises if the economy fails to grow.

articles.title: UK agrees post-Brexit deal over Gibraltar
articles.description: Talks on rules governing the border of Spain and Gibraltar have been ongoing since Britain left the EU.

articles.title: Council tax expected to rise by 5% a year
articles.description: Council tax is expected to rise by 5% a year to pay for local services, documents in the Spending Review suggest.

articles.title: Reeves boosts NHS and housing as some budgets squeezed
articles.description: Some departments, including the Home Office and Foreign Office, have lost out in the government's Spending Review.

articles.title: US reviewing Aukus submarine pact as part of 'America First' agenda
articles.description: It comes as Australia faces pressure from the White House to dramatically lift its military spending.

articles.title: Key points at a glance from the Spending Review
articles.description: Chancellor Rachel Reeves unveils how the government plans to spend money in the coming years.

articles.title: Drakeford loses temper with Plaid leader
articles.description: Drakeford accuses Rhun ap Iorwerth of being "very bad at listening" as he is heckled.

articles.title: Leon Brittan's widow says 'no closure' from false abuse claims after case dropped
articles.description: Lady Diana Brittan says her falsely accused late husband's legacy has been permanently tarnished.

articles.title: O'Neill calls for Lyons to resign over Facebook post ahead of Larne attack
